lead_paragraph: HARVEY--Jane Wood, intrepid traveler, avid gardener and reader, died on May 21 in Litchfield, CT following a brief illness. She was 88 years old. Born in Texarkana, AR, she was the daughter of Esther Mills and Willard Lyman Wood. She attended The Hockaday School and graduated from Radcliffe College in 1949. She married writer Clement Biddle Wood, Jr. that same year. Together they lived in Philadelphia and Paris before their divorce in 1964. In 1972 she married C. Daggett Harvey of Chicago, where she lived for several decades and served on the Board of the Art Institute of Chicago. Following his death in 1976 she spent portions of the year in Gstaad and London, where she completed a degree in horticultural restoration. During much of the 1990's she lived and worked at the Villa Noailles in Grasse, France, restoring its garden, before moving to New York in 2001. She is survived by her children from her first marriage, Marion Wood Covey (Joseph Harmon) of Chicago, Clement Biddle Wood III (Sally) of New York City, Willard Lyman Wood (Susannah) of Norfolk, CT, and Alexander Mills Wood (Susan Manno) of Canajoharie, NY, and by eight grandchildren and stepgrandchildren. There will be a private family service. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Old Westbury Gardens, P.O. Box 430, Old Westbury, NY 11568. 1/3
